Package com.fdmgroup.spring.timothy_chai_ecommerce_project.controller

Class CustomerController

java.lang.Object
com.fdmgroup.spring.timothy_chai_ecommerce_project.controller.CustomerController
@Controller @RequestMapping("/customer") @Transactional(readOnly=false) public class CustomerController extends Object
This class is the customer controller that handles all the requests related to the customer. These requests include customer registration, login, adding to likes, and removing from likes
Author:
- timothy.chai

  • Method Details

    • registerCustomer

      @GetMapping("/register-customer") public String registerCustomer()
      Handles the request for registering a new customer account.
      Returns:
      The registerCustomer view.

    • loginCustomer

      @GetMapping("/login") public String loginCustomer()
      Handles the login request.
      Returns:
      The customerLogin view.

    • processRegistration

      @PostMapping("/registration") public String processRegistration(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Processes the customer registration form.
      Parameters:
      request - The HTTP request object containing registration form data.
      Returns:
      The "complete" page after registering the customer.

    • processLogin

      @PostMapping("/login-customer") public String processLogin(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Processes the customer login form.
      Parameters:
      request - The HTTP request object containing login form data.
      Returns:
      The view to be displayed after login. If login is successful, user is redirected to the product dashboard.

    • addToLikes

      @PostMapping("/addToLikes") public String addToLikes(@SessionAttribute Customer customer, @RequestParam int productID)
      Adds a product to the customer's likes.
      Parameters:
      customer - The currently logged-in customer retrieved from session attributes.
      productID - The ID of the product to be added to likes.
      Returns:
      A redirection to the product dashboard page.

    • removeFromLikes

      @PostMapping("/removeFromLikes") public String removeFromLikes(@SessionAttribute Customer customer, @RequestParam int productID)
      Removes a product from the customer's likes.
      Parameters:
      customer - the currently logged-in customer retrieved from session attributes.
      productID - the ID of the product to be removed from likes.
      Returns:
      link the redirection to the product dashboard page.
